website_summaries.verdict: This highly-rated shopping cart combines durability and foldability with the capacity to transport up to 120 lbs. worth of goods.
pros: Water-resistant canvas bag can be closed to protect contents from rain and snow
Lightweight and easy to pack up into a car trunk or backseat
Easy to set up, with no assembly required
Can take up and down even longer stairwells in condos or apartment buildings
cons: Some taller users would like to see the handles extend higher
Very heavy items on the bottom may cause bag to sag

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect...if wheels were spaced further apart.
customer_reviews.text: I live across from Kroger and use this to walk over and shop for groceries. Love this thing! The only complaint I have is that since I'm tall (5'8)...I have a long stride and sometimes my foot will hit the wheel as I walk. It would be perfect if the wheels were spaced a little wider apart. It's very lightweight and easy to carry down the stairs at my apartment and it's great that it folds up. I store it in my pantry and it takes up hardly any room! I'll be getting a lot of use out of this!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Husted

customer_reviews.title: IT'S A PIECE OF CHEAP CRAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP. VERY CHEAP. DO NOT EVEN BUY THIS SHOPPING CART. I HAD IT FOR UNDER 3 MONTHS & THE DAMN WHEELS CHIPPED AND BROKE BEYOND REPAIR. ALL THEY TOLD ME IS "THE 30-DAY RETURN" HAS PASSED. SO I WASTED MY MONEY. JUST DON'T BUY IT. I RATED THIS ONE STAR BUT I'D RATE IT "ZERO" STARS IF I HAD THE OPTION.
customer_reviews.author: Longtime Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved this cart
customer_reviews.text: I loved this cart, it really transports 120 pounds or even more. Excellent product, I don't have a car, so I normally take the bus, and it fixs just perfect on the bus, and getting into the groceries store everyone likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: It was great until it broke - if you buy, get it from a seller that will stand behind the product.
customer_reviews.text: I only had this for almost three months before the handle broke. My ex and my mother both have one so I thought I would invest given their recommendation. I like the cart but the one I received must've been defective or came damaged. The handle has almost cracked off and it only had 10lbs in it. The seller - UnbeatableSale Inc - will not stand behind the defective product. Their return policy is only for 30 days. Buyer beware - find a vendor that will stand behind what they sell and that has a longer return policy than 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Question is what can it not hold?
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I've had this cart for literally 3 years meaning I purchased it on October 2014. And it's still working!!!! Living in an aprtement, I can't imagine my life without this little (yet sturdy) cart! It helped me transport my grocery at least 500 times in these three years and I had no problem with it at all. Reason that I decide to leave a review after three years of purchase is when I came back to buy another one, I saw bad reviews here. Not sure how those people had bad experiences with it but I love it! It made my life so much easier! And look at the pictures, tell me what it cannot hold??
customer_reviews.author: AnnieCorgi

customer_reviews.title: It broke after a year...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this cart almost a year ago and it is really a nice cart. But after almost a year, the front left wheel broke on the steel part. I contacted the customer service of versacart, to see qhat they can do about it. I was asked to provide a photo, which was a promising sign since it showed they care, but after I provided the photo, they did not reply back. I wanted to just buy the cart, since the bag is still intact, but there is no such option. I tried to brace it with a piece of metal but it is hopeless now.
customer_reviews.author: Fatih

customer_reviews.title: bag shredded at seam after 15-20 uses
customer_reviews.text: I am changing my review... I love this cart, it so easy to open and close, it holds a lot of bags and/or laundry, it even used to wheel over the sidewalk nicely. But last month (after 3 months of use) one of the back wheels started acting up. I ignored it because it was still riding decently. Last night, after 4 months after purchase, I noticed the front of the bag is shredding at the seam. I only use this cart at most once a week so if you do the math, this cart broke after approximately 16-20 uses. Very disappointing- I am hoping the company makes it right and replaces the bag
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Lypowy

customer_reviews.title: Great cart, but too expensive on Amazon... Try elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Oh versacart how I love thee. Help with laundry, packages, groceries-- you can do it all. It's been 3 years and my love for you has only grown. I don't know how I lived without you, versacart. I only paid $50 for you on Amazon back then, and it was the right price. And if, heaven forbid, you ever buckle under the weight of one too many packages, I will surely replace you. Only.... not through Amazon. Heck, you're great and all, but $70 is a little steep, even for you, so.... guess it'll have to be through Bed Bath and Beyond! (Where it's still $50 and add a 20% off coupon-- hello?! Done deal.)
customer_reviews.author: elisainnyc

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my holy grail right now! Living in an apartment complex it is rough getting so many groceries and making 5 trips up and down from the car. This cart is great, easy to assemble, easy to fold and put away. I took off a star bc for the price I paid I expect the cart to be a little better in quality. It doesn’t feel like the materials are as nice as they should be but the cart is still very sturdy and such. I guess I just had higher expectations. The cart also has a strong plastic-y smell when you first open it- not a big deal, but just a heads up. It airs out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Maala

customer_reviews.title: A Sad Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: On the very first time I used this product, it's 2 front wheels buckled. It was loaded with less than 60 lbs, well within the purported 150 lbs. capacity that it is supposed to be able to transport. I am very familiar with utility carts, so I carefully and slowly navigated uneven sidewalks and pavement. As I slowly tried to guide it slowly up a driveway apron, first it's left front side above the wheel buckled. Then a block away the right side gave way. With its swiveling front wheels, I thought this cart would be the solution to a problem. It failed spectacularly.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: I really expected better quality for the price. This cart is poorly made and falling apart after only a few uses. Very disappointed. Bag is coming undone at the seams and frame is coming off hinges. The wheels don't look very sturdy either.
customer_reviews.author: Susana Q.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and service
customer_reviews.text: This cart is made differently from the one we had previously which was fine. This one started to fall apart within weeks and although I tried to fix it, the repair would not hold. When I tried to contact the Seller, the reply said that they no longer made this cart and referred me to another company (at the same address?). It is impossible to reach that outfit which has a number of bad reviews and BBB negative complaints. I think Amazon should not sell this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Loves This
customer_reviews.text: Most of the grocery carts that are out there are pretty flimsy, almost as though the manufacturers are taking advantage of the vulnerable disabled and elderly that need to use them. This is the 2nd time I have purchased this brand for my daughter. The first cart last about 3 years, and it really was the best one she ever owned. She is pretty on equipment, but when she wore out the other one, this is the brand she requested. The frame and wheel outlasted the liner. And I do wish Versacart sold a liner for this cart separately in case of this circumstance. That said, 9 out of 10 for this product in terms of price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Juvik

customer_reviews.title: Our Second One
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shopping cart. It holds four full grocery bags and the cover keeps them dry if raining/snowing. It folds up quickly just by pushing up the metal bar at the back with your foot and the handles let you hang the cart on a clothes bar. We have ours hanging in the hall closet by the front door -- very convenient to grab and go. The canvas material is heavy duty and can be washed. We bought our first cart about 12 years ago and it's still going. We plan on using that one for garden chores.
customer_reviews.author: MoveeBuff

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart! It's well worth the money, because it's twice as nice as the usual, single-fold 4-wheeled carts. I ride the bus all over Seattle, and this cart folds up to a far more manageable size and shape than the one I had before. The cover is nice, and the wheels are smooth. I can stand it on its own while it's folded, which makes a huge difference in it's manageability at bus stops, or anywhere else. Its bottom is not as low, which is great for me, with a bad back; less bending when I retrieve items.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Duvall

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN ANY CART I've ever owned . . .
customer_reviews.text: I live in a large city in a 500-unit condo apartment building. We have a herd of wheelie carts on our loading dock to help with grocery unloads, but I shop at the same time everyone else does, and I NEED MY OWN CART! THIS ONE FOLDS easily and becomes small enough to fit into even small cars. I can even take it on the jitney bus a major big box store sends to my area! I haven't been without a grocery cart for the past 40 years, but this is the best one ever!!! Best of all: IT'S STURDY, ROOMY, VERSATILE AND EASY TO PUSH/PULL!!! And, it takes less room, folded up in my small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: PHOEBE HOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Best shopping cart!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this more than 5 stars, I would. I moved my mom into senior living apartments with an elevator. I thought this would be great so she can take her groceries from the car up to her apartment. Little did I know she would use it to take the trash down, carry things to the car and help others in her building. The fabric is heavy and feels very sturdy. It collapses very nice to store in the trunk. Highly recommend this shopping cart! My mom loves it and others in the building have cart envy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but still great
customer_reviews.text: This is more of a 4.5 star review. I don't think it's perfect but I'm happy with my purchase. I love that it folds up and has a flip cover that is water resistant. The bag is made out of thick material too so it doesn't tear easily. A few complaints, one the wheels seem to be made out of some compact styrofoam material which makes it light but it doesn't have as good of traction as rubber ones. Two the bars on the bottom don't lay completely flat so there's a bit sticking up on the bottom. I still really like it and every time I take it somewhere people ask where I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: In my quest for the perfect "wheels" I tried several different carts and this one truly is the best for the size. It has handles that are tall enough for my 6' height, the wheels are excellent and move easily all the time and it folds down to the size of a collapsible stroller. It is sturdy, holds a lot and is excellent. I liked it so much that I bought two - one for my car and one for my laundry in the house so I can easily wheel my laundry down to the laundry room down the hall in my building. Plus it pretty much comes put together. Just need to snap on the front wheels. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Whackyaunt

customer_reviews.title: Solid enough for heavy items and carries a lot!
customer_reviews.text: Great cart - solid enough for heavy items and big enough for a lot of grocery bags. This is basically a stroller base with a large nylon storage bag instead of a seat. The nylon is heavy duty and the cart is easy to steer. It does take up a decent amount of space in my trunk, but it's well worth it given the large capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Breaks very easily
customer_reviews.text: I only used my cart 2 times before it broke. The second time I used it the wheel started to wobble. Then I tried to fold it back together at the end of use. There is a metal bar at the bottom back of the unit that all of a sudden somehow was very bent, making me unable to fold the cart. There was really no way to return the item with the box it came it, so I just threw it away. This item looks very practical but in reality it's a piece of junk and probably has very cheap parts. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: The stiching ripped open!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product thinking the price was worth it because it seemed so strong that it would definitely last for years, I was wrong! I probably used it 20 times (for groceries, nothing more) before the stiching ripped off. I'm so upset! For this price it's better to just buy the metal ones and change them every 2 years. Don't waste your time or money!!
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easily folds/unfolds.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy cart suitable for a variety of uses. I primarily use it for trucking groceries from several blocks away, over city streets and sidewalks. I like that it folds/unfolds easily, but there isn't really a good way to roll it along when it is in its folded state; I just pick it up by the cross bar and carry it. As some have noted, it is relatively easy to step on the rear wheels when rolling the cart in its unfolded state, but I don't know of an effective design preventative for this - just pay attention to your stride. I love the fact that it has a velcro'd cover to protect your load.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: "Best thing I ever bought"
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. After years of using this at least twice a week, it still is doing great. Just the canvas is a little worn but the machinery is still stellar. My husband says this is the best purchase I've every made after 36 years of marriage. LOL He loves it so much I call it his girlfriend. It has made our lives so much easier considering our condo is pretty far from our parking space. W eve had it for 2 years now. We still love it and use it a lot. I would highly recommend this as a very savvy buy. You wont be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen K

customer_reviews.title: Great cart when living in a small condo!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I expected! Just love it. It folds up so small that it is easy to store in our trunk or our coat closet. The only trick is when we have to go over a bit of a lip in the concrete. It prefers really smooth surfaces, but this is easily navigated by pressing gently on the backside of the cart to pop up the front wheels a little. Like other reviews said, it is wise to distribute weight when putting in groceries, etc. Not a problem for us. This holds a lot! Perfect cart for living in a condo!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, highly maneuverable cart with plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace a metal cart that finally gave out. Only have had it for 30+ days. Very easy to assemble (just two wheels that snap on, no screws, no wrench). Frankly, I was skeptical; it is lightweight, hence, I didn't think it was able to support heavy/big loads. I was completely wrong. I loaded three (3) six-packs of 1 liter bottled water (18 liters), several bags of groceries, detergent (100 load), and a few other sundries; despite the heavy load, everything fit easily in the bag, and, to my surprise (and relief!), the cart moved easily to/from the elevator to my apartment. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: q394017

customer_reviews.title: Great cart, if used on flat terrain. Not to be pulled up stairs
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cart, it’s very compact, modern and sleek. It has a great cover which protects your inner bags. The downside is though as sturdy and compact of a cart, the handles loosen up easily. Fortunately for me I’m a person who constantly checks things out. So every so often I check if any screws have loosen up. The other down side is, it isn’t made to pull up a stair nor a step up. It’s just not strong enough to sustain a pull up any stairs. The cart wouldn’t go up the steps. I don’t regret the cart, it’s an amazing one!
customer_reviews.author: GastonRoberge

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful and convenient cart. I have just moved into a small apartment so the fact that it folds up like a portable chair makes it easy to store. I use it to get my groceries and other things from the car and up the elevator and to transport my laundry to and from the laundry room. Very easy to maneuver. Someone here has owned one for 5 years and she needs to replace the bag. I suppose that depends on how much wear and tear it gets. I am very happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: jo jo

customer_reviews.title: Good cart for short people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bring groceries home from nearby stores or from my car parking spot a few doors down. While it works as specified, I have to stoop uncomfortably to push it. I'm 6'1" and my wife at 5'8" also thinks the handles are too low. There is no way to adjust the handles-- they're each riveted to the top of their tubes. I'm thinking of modifying the cart and wonder if anybody else has had success with extending the handles higher.
customer_reviews.author: salsaman

customer_reviews.title: The best shopping cart ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I lived in highrises for over 15 years and I've tried several folding carts usually the wire basket kind. This is the best of all of them. I saw a woman on the bus with one and thought I'd give it a try. It holds a lot of groceries. And it stands on its own when folded. None of my other carts did that or folded so small. It lightweight but sturdy. And putting it together was a simple as putting a cap (with the wheels) on a post. No tools or hand strength needed.
customer_reviews.author: MeghanTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Best cart I have used - strongest one also
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review for this already, it may have been deleted? I use it for grocery shopping and going to the laundry. Grocery store is about a mile away - I can put easily over 120 pounds in here and wheel it back to my house no problem. Definitely a must for someone like me with no car at the moment. Used to have cars but now I am trying to be more eco friendly and this helps. Way better than the other carts here that look like a wagon - I have seen those fail in action. It even has a cover and it is WATER PROOF!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boogeyman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I’m in my mid 60’s, retired, and I live in a city with excellent public transportation. Therefore, I use the cart for grocery shopping. It is a dream to push (one-handed!), and I especially like the enclosed container and top for rainy days and security. I’m 5’4” with short arms, and this cart is comfortable for me to push two-handed. It would be even better with adjustable handle length for taller people.
customer_reviews.author: Donna King

customer_reviews.title: Love it it but slightly tricky for taller people
customer_reviews.text: Best cart! So much easier than the wagon style one. * note... if you are over 5’10”... you will need to take shorter strides in order not to kick it as you push it. However, I walk beside it when in a rush... easily pulls and turns with one hand guiding. Would be great if the handles were a bit further away from the cart for tall people but you can work around it and it’s fabulous! Use it for so much... bringing in groceries, pick up packages, take heavy stuff from one room to the other. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: great little cart for small apartment
customer_reviews.text: We have recently moved into a small apartment, and because of covid19 we are now getting all our groceries delivered to the building but not to our apartment. I use this cart, which is tucked along the wall of a closet taking up hardly any space, to go down to the lobby, load all our groceries, wheel it back up in an elevator and after unloading LOTS of groceries, tuck it back away again. We love it! We will certainly continue to use it when we are going out to do our own shopping.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended For Singles Over 5'5"
customer_reviews.text: So, it's sturdy, easy to store, and not hard to carry up and down stairs when collapsed (assuming you're not holding other stuff). However, the handle heights aren't adjustable, and, at 5'6", I have to walk at an uncomfortable angle to push it. It's also not great if you have a lot of stairs in your life, because you can't lift the inner bag out if it's full - the bulk gets caught on the metal frame. You have to carry the whole cart, or unload in a few trips. After several months, I'm unfortunately regretting the purchase. I'd recommend for shorter folks who don't have staircases, OR who have someone to help.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I was looking for. My mom moved into an apartment and was worried about getting groceries to third floor. The item is light and doesn't require steps to fold. It just collapses right up and unfolds even easier. the canvas makes it lightweight. It's also very roomy and looks like it will hold more groceries than most other carts; and none of your items can stick out anywhere. Wheels were easily maneuverable. The canvas also keeps all your stuff from being visible to others.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today
customer_reviews.text: And I love it! The box was propped next to the garage when I arrived home from shopping. I popped it out if the box, attached two front wheels and loaded it up with a car load of stuff. I have a 17 year old hip replacement that's starting to act up and I'm babying it trying to stretch a revision surgery out as long as possible. This saves so many trips and so much weight off my hip. It even is a bit of walking assistance although a tiny bit short for me at 5'8"ish-have shrunk some with osteoporosis. Only the first day, but very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, compact, durable, very easy to complete assembly!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is awesome! Purchased as a gift to elderly neighbors who recently moved to a retirement home. Their condo is a bit of a walk from parking so wanted to make transporting groceries, etc. as easy as possible. No problem finishing assembly, insert front wheels until they click. Folds inward for easy storage, seems very sturdy, front wheels swivel for easy turns. Honestly, I am ashamed to admit that I rely on Amazon so much, but it is so easy to compare products on the market, read reviews, purchase and return with confidence, especially when I am not familiar with the product and what’s on the market. One stop shopping in my home whenever I choose to do it!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Easy to push and holds a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few months and its indispensable. I live in an apartment building but walking distance to a grocery and can load this up and walk home easily. I've also lugged things to my storage room and brought home paint and items from the hardware store. Folds easily and doesn't take up too much room in the trunk. Like others have said, if they could make adjustable handles so that they could be a bit taller that would be great. I am only 5'4" but even I find they are a little short. Overall nice quality, seems very durable, and
customer_reviews.author: Carole Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great little shopping cart!
customer_reviews.text: Love my cart and use it all the time! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it doesn't have a level, solid, sturdy bottom or come with an insert for the bottom. I did have a piece of wood that I put in the bottom to hold heavier items and keep them level. Other than that, it's nice and light and can be maneuvered with one hand while you zip through the store! I'm the only who uses the cart so I don't have to wipe it down for every trip to the store or have to sanitize or touch the store's carts! Definitely would recommend this cart!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: The wheels suck, I have to lift the cart myself if ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess it depends the use you want to give it. I wanted to use it for laundry and could only fit 1 laundry bag. It also looks too fragile, but only time will tell. The wheels suck, I have to lift the cart myself if i find the slighest irregularity on the street... Too much work. Only good thing about it is that it doesnt weigh anything by itself, which is a plus when I'm getting it down the stairs
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Love new cart!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd purchase of this cart. Love the new model. I’ve also purchased for mother who lives in senior housing. I live in condo, and cart is useful for all seasons to bring in items from car; (especially cases of water and groceries). Also helpful in taking out trash. Instead of making multiple trips, I can do it all in 1. It saves my back. I‘ve received many compliments, and I recommend it to everyone. Mother uses it to do her laundry. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well - light weight
customer_reviews.text: Mom asked for this item for Christmas. She borrowed the same model from a friend and then wanted her own. It quickly assembled when removed from the box. It is light enough that she can easily fold and put in her trunk. The handles are at a comfortable height for some 5' 5". This is great when most umbrella style baby strollers are too low. The only challenge is packing the grocery bags individually and then into the cart in a way that nothing gets squished or broken. Slight learning curve on our end...
customer_reviews.author: SLC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Groceries!
customer_reviews.text: I moved to San Francisco, and use this at least once a week on grocery jaunts to Trader Joe's or Safeway. It's incredibly easy to use and worth every penny to not have to carry bags of groceries. At first I thought it might look kind of dorky, but now I notice a lot of people use these. I do with the handles were adjustable somewhat. I am 5'7" and have to stoop a bit to push with the low handles.
customer_reviews.author: The Lizzie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Working very well for groceries
customer_reviews.text: Looked at quite a few folding carts before purchasing this one. Works well for us carrying groceries in from the car. Durable construction, holds quite a number of grocery sacks (as long as we put the heavy items on the bottom), unfolds/folds easily. What I really like is that it will stand by itself (as long as the 2 swiveling wheels are in the correct position) so we can leave it by the garage door for easy use when needed.
customer_reviews.author: rcn

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This cart has been a lifesaver for me. I live on the second floor with an elevator and all my groceries go into this cart. A case of water, juices, can goods, etc. it holds about 15 bags of groceries. I moved from one condo to another and used this in my move. It was excellent! It is very sturdy and folds up easily and I toss it on my backseat floor. I ordered another one that is stored in my closet as I never want to be without one! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: I Use It ALL the Time!
customer_reviews.text: I restock our hospital clothes closets on a weekly basis so I was looking for something that I could use to move these items easily. This was perfect. It keeps all the clothing inside clean and has a cover to go over in case I'm bringing underwear over or something. The cart steers well and I can even put it in the back of my car. My only complaint is that every time I walk around with it someone stops me to tell me they thought is was a STROLLER. After a year of hearing this, I just laugh about it and go along.
customer_reviews.author: Feli

customer_reviews.title: Make your life easier at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have 4 of these to carry things up and down elevator in the 2 high rise condo buildings in which our Mothers live. We keep one on each of our cars and one in each of the condos, so there is always one handy for anything going up or down. They're very study, roll and maneuver easily and fold up nicely to fit in our trunks, or stand in a closet. You can buy cheaper ones, but you'll learn, as we did, that these cats deliver a great product at a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Yoakum

customer_reviews.title: Great cart, light weight and folds up nicely
customer_reviews.text: My old cart was falling apart and I needed a new one for garage sales and craft fairs. This one works great, it's deep and holds a lot of stuff. I did buy a stroller cup holder to add onto it and now it is perfect!! It also comes with a cover which is great for keeping hands out of your cart and for keeping the weather out too. It only weighs 6 lbs so it's better than my old car that weighed 30!
customer_reviews.author: Masterttech Automotive

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This folding cart by VersaCart is marvelous! I moved to an apartment where I had a long walk from the parking garage to my place and was tired of making trips back and forth to my car to unload groceries, etc. The cart is deep and can hold a LOT of things. It rolls well. It is easy to fold up; and when it is folded up it does not take up much space in the trunk. It is light weight. It is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cart!!!
customer_reviews.text: A neighbor had one for bringing her groceries up to her 4th floor apartment (via elevator), so I purchased one. I have used it only once, but have been very happy; it easily handled a case of wine, plus more packages on my trip in. It is lightweight, but very durable; the "basket" is made of a heavier duty material which should offer many years of service (like when I will have to use it for all my groceries!). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DFBMan

customer_reviews.title: The easiest court you will ever buy
customer_reviews.text: This card is one of the best purchases I have ever made. It is 30 so easy to maneuver because of the rotating wheels. It is lightweight and I use it almost daily. It falls so easily and stands on its own.I once forgot it at my sons house and that quickly bought another one. I will not do without it. The only criticism I have is why is the red $0 more than the blue one, what is that about?
customer_reviews.author: Mosaic Melody

customer_reviews.title: This is a 10 star product!
customer_reviews.text: So handy. I would give it 10 stars. Can fill to the brim - 3 huge watermelons, etc. and it still turns and moves well. I think it is indispensable - I use it at the grocery store, Costco, and it even holds my dog. I bought 2 other types - none compared to this.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This cart is such a great product. I live in a building with a long hallway from the stairs or elevator to my door and bringing in anything more than a couple bags, especially anything heavy was a struggle. This has been a lifesaver for my hands (since I tried to always make one trip. Not recommended). The cart frame is sturdy and easily maneuverable. The basket itself is made well and is durable and detachable if cleaning is required. I’d definitely recommend this and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a super product. It holds more than I expected, easily at least 4 grocery bags if not more. I use it for laundry, and to take out the trash, because I have to go a ways to the dumpster. It is very steady on its wheels, and maneuvers smoothly. It pushes easily, and makes a heavy load seem much lighter. You can take the blue bag off and wash it out, so no smell issue. I have been using it for about a month, so I can't speak to how it holds up for the long haul. But I love my cart, and think it was well worth the extra dollars over a standard utility cart.
customer_reviews.author: C. Knox

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this BUT it needs to be redesigned a little bit. I'm 5'9" and I find this cart is too short and hurts my back when pushing it. Either this needs longer handles or telescopic handles to make them either longer or shorter depending on the person pushing the cart. I've used this many times now and I really like how lightweight it is as well as how well it folds together as I keep this in my car to help with getting my groceries to my apartment on the 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: daenas

customer_reviews.title: Makes taking groceries on the bus a lot easier
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I take the bus and this really helps with shopping. It is also water proof, so if it rains a bit, no problem. Very easy to assemble. When you get it all you do it just pop 2 wheels on. Received lots of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: H. Houdini

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend to old people
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 70yr old mother with back and knee problems. She loves this cart and thanks me for it after having it for about a year. She says it fits all her groceries even cat litter and it’s easy to push.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Looked on Amazon and discovered this amazing shopping cart
customer_reviews.text: We were moving from a house to an apartment and wondered how we would get groceries from the car to the apartment - quite a concern. Looked on Amazon and discovered this amazing shopping cart. It is so versatile - holds a surprising amount of stuff. It then ever so easily folds up to the size of an umbrella -- well, maybe, five umbrellas! The wheels move smoothly and easily. I cannot think of one negative to say about it. Thank you, Versacart, for a well thought out and well built shopping cart.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but lightweight hamper.
customer_reviews.text: I like this cart. It is lightweight, but sturdy. I use it as a hamper. It holds a whole week's laundry for me. The laundry room is on the other side of the house from my bedroom. I wheel my laundry to the l.r. with very little effort. Then I wheel the washed, dried and folded laundry back to my room. What used to be a very onerous, tiring task is now a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieV

customer_reviews.title: Just What I was Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cart! The canvas can be detached to be washed and it folds up very neatly so that it takes up very little space when it's not in use. I mainly use this to get heavier items into my apartment and it works great. A pack of 32 water bottles fits with no problem, three packs of soda can fit across the bottom without any problem either so it makes for a great way to bring in a lot of stuff in a single trip. Very useful and definitely worth the price tag! I prefer this to the wire carts because this is studier and doesn't have any problem supporting a great deal of weight. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Weissenburger

customer_reviews.title: pretty average), and I practically trip over the thing ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars, but the designer needs to deal with the foot-clearance issue. I am in the mid five foot range (i.e. pretty average), and I practically trip over the thing because there is not enough clearance and the handles are too low. A taller person would not like it at all. I feel like it wouldn't take much to make this thing awesome, it just needs a little product-designer TLC. The bin, BTW, holds plenty of stuff. It's the walking home part that sort of sucks
customer_reviews.author: julzstufz

customer_reviews.title: Live in an apartment --a must have
customer_reviews.text: I live in a high rise that provides us with mini shopping carts to schlep stuff from the car to the apartment. I notices that many of my neighbors had a versa cart despite being provided with shared shopping carts. OMG what a wonderful invention. It is light weight, folds easy like an umbrella, fits in the car and easy to maneuver. I could not live without and have bout it as a gift for my children living in an apartment. Do not hesitate better than old fashioned "granny" CARTS.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Miko

customer_reviews.title: VersaCart is a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The VersaCart exceeded my expectations - very sturdy and easy to handle. The fabric liner and frame are substantial and the cart is easy to maneuver. even when full of heavy items. I made the mistake of purchasing my last cart (not a VersaCart) several times, each time replacing one which had a larger basket than most, but also the same problem with a jamming wheel assembly. In frustration I ordered the VersaCart based on the excellent reviews it received. The VersaCart is less expensive than the previous ones I purchased, and the quality is clearly superior. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BDIllinois

customer_reviews.title: So good 😀
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone living in a condo/apt high rise. So convenient for all your groceries/purchases that you have to lug up and down the elevator Also great for taking your garbage out to the dumpster or trash shoot!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: rosie

customer_reviews.title: Well-constructed Cart
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful cart in almost every way. I am 5 ft. 2 inches and I must stoop over quite a way so I can push it well. I wish it were 4-5 inches higher and then it would be a perfect cart. It requires no assembly and folds and unfolds easily. It has a marvelous cover so when I haul toilet paper and other personal items, people don't know what I am hauling in my apartment elevator. I am able to put my cane inside the cart but then I can't attach the cover. The cart swivels beautifully and is worth the extra dollars it costs. Fast delivery with Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Kjersten

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - for folks that aren't super tall.
customer_reviews.text: One of the smartest purchases I've made this year. It works wonderfully for its intended purpose - going to the grocery store. But I also use it at the airport - they check this at the gate just like a stroller so it makes carrying around our crap when there are layovers much less cumbersome. We also bring it to farmer's market and even Target! It's just so handy. My only complaint is that the handles are a tad low. I'm 5'5 and have to stand close to avoid an awkward lean.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built cart that has met our needs to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built cart that has met our needs to a "t"! Holds more than you realize at first. We keep it in the trunk and it's so useful at the flea market or vegetable market or any place. Anywhere you might buy things and don't want to haul bags around in your arms you can have the luxury of rolling this like a stroller. It's not bulky and weighs about 17 pounds. We love using it. It even has a top cover if you need to protect something or you get caught in the rain. It's very helpful from car to kitchen with grocery bags! Very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Magbelieves

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart. It's fairly small when folded, lightweight and easy to carry, but I'm blown away by how much it will transport. I even have 3 large steps from my garage into the house and I can maneuver the cart up those steps with very little effort. What used to take me 3-4 trips to carry everything from my trips to the local big box store can now be made in 1-2 trips and it's much easier on my arms and back. I would definitely purchase this item again. I've only had it about a month, but I've transported some really heavy loads (bottled water, soft drinks, etc) and the cart has held up beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: jm in Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Mine was of poor quality - ripped - return was accepted 2 weeks after.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shopping cart for my grandparents. After about 2 weeks of light use, the bottom seem ripped in two places. This company accepted the return and I received my money back, but now I need to find something better. Thank you for accepting the return. Perhaps it was just a faulty unit sent to me. My grandparents are 87 years old, they used it for light groceries maybe twice a week. Nothing heavy or with sharp corners was ever placed into the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Parks Jr

customer_reviews.title: This is literally the best $60 I've ever spent
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the best $60 I've ever spent. I've owned a few of these kinds of carts, and wish I'd bought this one the first time. It's sturdy, the wheels are not cheap, and pretty robust. it's easy to open and close. It fits in my trunk. I can fit a full grocery run for two (and we go big on groceries) every two weeks, and get it up to my upper floor apartment. I pack the main bin of the cart, and then hang bags on the handles. It takes a lot of bags that way. It's also easy to steer. This is the best grocery cart I've bought yet.
customer_reviews.author: Wolsey

customer_reviews.title: It works, is easy to put together and is super handy!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started doing contract for a grocery shopping and delivery service. This cart has been a life-saver for delivering multiple bags of grocery in homes and multi-story apartment and retirement homes. It has also saved my back by reducing the trips I need to make to finalize the delivery. It's well built, and is a life saver for me. It easily goes up stairs and maneuvers very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tacomapat

customer_reviews.title: This thing smelled like all of the chemicals when I opened it but ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing smelled like all of the chemicals when I opened it but a quick airing out fixed that. However I am not sure this would safely hold 120lbs like it says. I put about 40-50lbs worth of groceries in here and the wheels were nearly buckling. I am only 5' and have trouble pushing this as my legs and feet run into it. So I cant imagine a taller person pushing this easily. It will work for small trips to the store and laundry, but I wouldnt push it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Light, and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shopping cart! I haven't been used to using one, but after being loaned a rickety metal one, and I saw that despite it's heavy weight, it would be a convenience to have one - I researched and found this one. Made my first trip with it - it's much lighter - and it holds four larger grocery bags and more. I was stopped several times in the parking lot by those who wanted to know where I got it. It's easy to fold up, put in the trunk, and then, when empty, refolds easily to fit in a cramped closet. I'm VERY pleased with this cart!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Can hold a lot very sturdy lightweight and folds up I been trying not to use car so much since stores are close by so I purchased this to get groceries and other items home I live 2 blocks from store I can put half gallon milk, cat litter 2 bags of groceries and still have room for more then wheel it home harder to maneuver over rocks and stairs. I leave it downstairs and carry groceries up (townhouse) I like that it has waterproof bag since I live in rainy climate. I feel it was a good purchase. Also great at farmers market much easy to carry all the veggies, flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Handles are not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a bit ago and used it to go up and down to my building's laundry room. Today was the 1st time I took it out to buy groceries, the total not coming close to the weight guidance associated with the cart. The one time I had to lever the handles to tip the cart's front upward to exit a bus, the right handle broke. How can this be? Frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: PussterPop

customer_reviews.title: Good for lazy people like myself
customer_reviews.text: Drama free. Ready to go without extra work. Good for lazy people like myself! lol
customer_reviews.author: Shopper5

customer_reviews.title: Great great cart!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart, I really do. Only problem is it came with a broken handle. I actually used it anyway because I desperately needed it as I ride the bus and needed groceries. It's great for that! A little big for fitting nicely on the bus but hey, it works! I love the ease of the movement and the nicer appearance than most carts. Only problem is when it is heavily loaded the wheels don't move as easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for older folks who need a hand bringing in groceries.
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for my elderly parents who still get around, but not as easily as they used to. It's perfect for bringing groceries from the car into their condo, so they don't have to make multiple trips. It folds up easily, is well made and has a well thought out rain flap on it so that things don't get wet if the weather is bad. I'm very happy with it, and more importantly so are they.
customer_reviews.author: Seventh-777Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Easiest, lightest, and useful thing you'll buy to help you.
customer_reviews.text: It helps as a walker without looking like one. It carries a lot of groceries and other goodies. It handles easily no matter if you have light stuff in it or if it is really heavy. When empty, you just fold it up like an umbrella, snap the strap, and put it in your car for the next time. Every time I do that I am amazed how light it is. I have severe arthritis. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart
customer_reviews.text: This cart is great. I live in a big city and schlepping things is a way of life. Those big metal carts didn't cut it for me; they didn't fit in my closet and never stand on they're own when folded. I use this, loaded with groceries, to walk the 15 blocks from Trader Joe's to my apartment. I've carted my laundry to the basement, loaded it with things to donate to the local charity and it's been flawless. The only complaint I have is I wish the handled came up a bit higher. I'm 5'7" and I find myself having to hunch a bit when pushing it around, especially those 15 blocks. Otherwise, it's been rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: RtisticFX

customer_reviews.title: This is the 4th one I have purchased for family members! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My sister is some what disabled. She just moved into a condo. This folding cart is perfect for her to transport groceries from her car to her condo. It folds up nicely in her SUV making it very easy to use. It is light weight so she is able to handle it with ease. I know it is durable as my daughter and other sister have been using theirs for several years. This is a solid cart that will give you years of service.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best shopping cart ever it’s so light weight mines came with a small tear in the bottom but I just left it, i love how it folds and the wheels are turn. Bought one for my grandmother and after her friends are the senior center saw they ask me to order them one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: broke the wheel in less than 1 month (used 6 times)
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give 0 stars. I can't express how mad I am. I only use this to buy stuff from costco. I used it 6 times the seventh broke one of the front wheels and I have to manage to bring it with 3 wheel back home... I trying to manage how to get my money back from amazon for buying this garbage. Not sure how it is going to turn out.... don't be as stupid as I was buying this cra%
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Good qualtiy, but not the best choice for tall people
customer_reviews.text: Terrific for toting large/heavy loads which can be difficult to manage with the pull-behind model carts. The material is good quality. The frame and wheels are sturdy. My only criticisim is that it is meant for short people. I am 5’4’’ and I have to bend over somewhat to push the cart without my feet hitting the cart. To avoid this I walk to the side and push with one arm, though I cannot do this going uphill. Perhaps not the best choice for taller people.
customer_reviews.author: JJones

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this cart, although there are a couple of nuisance issues (the "lid" is too floppy to be useful and just gets in the way, the sides tend to sag a little). The wheels are sturdy and rotate easily, never have a problem with them. The cart is easy to set up, holds a lot of stuff, the materials are good quality and the handles are, well, handy. I use it for groceries and laundry. The package arrived quickly and in good order.
customer_reviews.author: deecomm46

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for grocery transport
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a relative who downsized into a condo. She loved it so much that two of her neighbors bought one as well. It holds a very surprising amount of groceries. She has pot a case of water and 4 very heavy grocery bags in one cart and had no problems!! Fabulous product!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product! Happy Customer!
customer_reviews.text: One of my fave Amazon purchases. I've been using this cart for several months now to walk to/from the farmers market & I've been asked so many times where I get the cart from. I buy a lot of fruit & veggies at a time, this puppy can take some serious weight & rugged enough to handle roads, sidewalks & bumps. Looking forward to buying another one for my mother real soon.
customer_reviews.author: Carol McGee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - sturdy, light weight, collapses for storage... just a great cart!
customer_reviews.text: super cart! lightweight and sturdy, easy to push, folds up nicely... I love it!!! it even has a flap that will protect your contents in case of rain, and (if using for groceries) keep your cool items cool. I love this little cart! I only wish the handles were just a few inches longer... I'm tall and I have to bend just a bit to push it... but I'm sure for most of the population the handles are the optimal height.
customer_reviews.author: Laura @ Island Paws Studio

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A LIFESAVER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new cart! I have a pet bakery and loading and unloading groceries was always a pain til I bought this wonderful cart. It’s nice and deep and even when I fill it with heavy groceries it still manuevers easily. Collapses down super quick and very light weight to throw in trunk. So happy I bought!!! Highly recommend especially to seniors
customer_reviews.author: S. thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great foldable shopping cart - used to carry all sorts!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this cart! I use to struggle with carrying 4-6 bags of groceries to my front door but now I don’t have to. I can load this cart up and use it for either carrying grocery bags from car to inside my place or for carting a pile of laundry down to the basement laundry room. I have found out that a neighbor of mine actually has one too. We both love our carts and they help us so much!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer in NorCal

customer_reviews.title: Best between apartment and parking garage or errands a few blocks away
customer_reviews.text: I always have tons and tons of stuff to take between my apartment and car in the lower level of our parking garage, whether it's groceries, an overnight bag, sports gear, etc. Even though we have an elevator the stuff gets heavy and I hate wasting time taking multiple trips up and down. This cart has changed my life! It rolls flawlessly and easily even with one hand. I live one block from almost everything I need in life, so I will also be using this on the streets for errands. Some days I feel like I look like a granny, some days I feel like a chic New Yorker. But who cares--it's worth the back ache!
customer_reviews.author: LW21

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made for great design
customer_reviews.text: The design is great BUT doesnt last very long... the bag starts to fall over. The handles are plastic and break.. for les money ok but I expect at least a few months if not years of use.
customer_reviews.author: OR

customer_reviews.title: Great Helper!!
customer_reviews.text: We just into an apartment cooperative from a house and noticed a lot of the of the shareholders using this for laundry. when going down to the laundry area in the elevators.This is a fabukous product and I wish it were a little bigger although I admit I do have a lot of laundry. Also great to keep one in the car trunk for bringing groceries up to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: I Shop 2

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart. It is big but also light and, as the wheels swivel, the cart is extremely easy to maneuver. I use it to carry groceries or anything heavy into the house and to carry the laundry in and out our laundry room. It is vertically foldable and stands by itself against the wall or inside the closet, which I find very convenient. I am 5.7 and would have liked the handles to be a little bit longer. But this is a minor complaint that does not affect in the least my love for the cart. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Co&Be

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and very easy for the elderly to use!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother in law who was having a hard time getting her groceries from the car to her second floor apartment. She is unable to carry much weight at one time. She loves it! She loads it up with groceries or whatever her purchases are rolls it into the elevator and down her very long hallway. It stores very easily in her trunk. She also uses it to take laundry to the laundry area. She is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskerdoc

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy cart!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a part time teacher, and I have to bring all my stuff to every class, including snacks and drinks. This cart can handle it all! It rolls easily on the double wheels. I've tried other rolling carts made from hard plastic, and the bottom falls out if you overload it! This one is designed differently, and so far, I haven't dropped my load in the road! Yay! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: S. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Love it, can carry a heavy items easily!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!! I was upgrading from the metal cart without multidirectional wheels and this glides so easy in comparison! I have had it several months and I use it to cart groceries when I have a lot to haul to my apartment. I overload it and it still rolls so smooth. Just this morning I loaded a case of bottled waters, 12 pk of cans, a large watermelon and various can goods, other fruit and then threw a big bag from target and another from shoe carnival on top of all that!
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!! Must buy for Condo living.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS CART!!! Living in a high-rise condo, it's never easy to grocery shop and lug up bags of groceries but this cart is made JUST FOR THAT! I am in love with this thing and highly recommend it. It's super durable--- it can hold the 40 pack of Costco bottle of waters PLUS an entire grocery shop with no worries. My only recommendation would be that I wish the handles were a big longer. I am 5'7" and I have to slouch a tad while pushing it, so I am sure if you are taller than me, you will have to walk a little bent over. All in all- A++- get it if you live in a high rise!!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: This cart has made my life much easier since moving to an apartment where I do my laundry on the first floor while I live on the tenth. Two plastic cube crates fit in cart perfectly so I can sort darks and lights in each crate. Then when I go to the Farmer's Market or grocery store I can fit everything in the two crates and the things in the bottom crate do not get mashed by the weight of the groceries or produce in the top crate. I couldn't be happier with this product.it's fantastic for someone like me who likes walking to stores or outdoor markets.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny loves a good read

product_meta.title: VersaCart Transit Original Folding Shopping and Utility Cart, Water-Resistant Heavy-Duty Canvas with Cover, Double Front Swivel Wheels, Compact Folding, Transport Up To 120 Pounds, Signature Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueImagine the load this sturdy, easy-rolling folding cart will take off you and your back. Lightweight at only 9 lbs, the patented original VersaCart Transit folding cart easily handles 120 lb of cargo and then some, yet folds up in a snap for compact storage in your trunk or closet. Use it for grocery, shopping, laundry, picnics, camping and so much more. The extra-large detachable polyblend canvas bag measures 21"H x 17"W x 18"D for a generous 3.72 cu ft capacity. The water-resistant bag has handles and a fitted cover for privacy and protection from the elements. Features thick ergonomic easy-grip handles and double wheels all around for maneuverability and stability. No assembly tools required. Simply pop in the swiveling front wheels and you're ready to roll. Move on from those old and tired flimsy chicken-wire carts. The patented VersaCart Transit is simply the best-value best-looking folding cart available.
feature_bullets: Patented rugged steel frame construction for strength and durability
Double front swivel wheels for maneuverability and double rear wheels for stability
Detachable extra-large water-resistant polyblend canvas bag with fitted cover for privacy and protection from the elements
Compact folding for convenient storage in tight places
No complicated assembly or tools required; simply click on the front wheels and go

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,806 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
